content: General Bank Account Asked by AnonymousAsked on 10 Aug 2018What are my rights if somebody wrongly transferred some money to me? Will I get charged if I do not return the money?If I need to take action to return the money, why am I being responsible for somebody else’s mistake?5 answersAnswerBump0

Png Cheng Xi DamienLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 10 Aug 2018It is against the law, but it will be a civil case. This means you can only get charged if the transferer hire a lawyer and do a claim from you via a court order. However, if the amount is not substantial, lawyer fees are not gonna be worth it.​Most likely, the bank will try to contact you and do a phone confirmation with you or what not (depending on their verification procedure) to get you to agree to return the money. Any trasnfer that has been effected and successfully transfered cannot be recalled without the account holder's consent, even if it was done on mistake.​That said, please return the money because you may not know how much the person really needs the money. By not returning, it makes you no different from those scammers cheating hard-earned monies.0 comments4

WizardAnswered on 10 Aug 2018Here's what I found online... a really interesting problem and unique in today's ePayment world - PayNow, PayLah, PayAnyone.​Indeed, a wire transfer (for us it's like FAST or bank transfers), in most cases, cannot be reversed. Some fraudulent wire transfers made from accounts, which do not have the funds on them, can be called off by the bank. ​Legitimate wire transfers (like the one someone makes to you), definitely, cannot be recalled.0 comments0
